working_definition: Other Health Impairment refers to having limited strength, vitality, or alertness, including a heightened alertness to environmental stimuli, that results in limited alertness with respect to the educational environment and adversely affects academic performance. This includes conditions such as asthma, ADHD, diabetes, epilepsy, a heart condition, hemophilia, lead poisoning, leukemia, nephritis, rheumatic fever, sickle cell anemia, and Tourette syndrome.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A condition marked by persistent inattention, hyperactivity, and impulsivity that interferes with functioning or development.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Epilepsy
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A neurological disorder marked by recurrent seizures that may require emergency protocols and monitoring.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Asthma
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A chronic lung condition that affects breathing and may require activity or environmental adjustments.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Diabetes
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A metabolic disorder that requires careful blood sugar monitoring and accommodations for snacks, insulin, and medical care.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Tourette Syndrome
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A neurological disorder characterized by repetitive, involuntary movements and vocalizations called tics.

common_presentations: Fatigue or limited stamina during school activities
Frequent absences due to illness or medical appointments
Difficulty focusing or staying on task
Needs access to medication, snacks, or restroom breaks
Episodes of medical emergencies or seizures
Behavior that appears impulsive or inattentive
Requires a predictable and structured routine
Sudden changes in performance or alertness
Difficulty with self-monitoring and emotional regulation

accommodations_modifications.name: Scheduled breaks and modified physical activity
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports students with limited stamina or chronic conditions
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Fatigue or limited stamina during school activities
accommodations_modifications.example: Student rests in nurse's office after lunch before returning to class

accommodations_modifications.name: Flexible attendance and makeup work policies
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces stress for students who miss school due to health
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Frequent absences due to illness or medical appointments
accommodations_modifications.example: Student has one week to complete assignments missed due to hospitalization

accommodations_modifications.name: Preferential seating and movement breaks
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty focusing or staying on task
accommodations_modifications.example: Student sits near the teacher and uses a stand-up desk option

accommodations_modifications.name: Health plan allowing snack, water, and restroom access
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Maintains medical stability and prevents health crises
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Needs access to medication, snacks, or restroom breaks
accommodations_modifications.example: Student keeps a snack in desk and has bathroom pass anytime

accommodations_modifications.name: Reduced exposure to triggers and allergens
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Prevents medical episodes in sensitive students
accommodations_modifications.example: Student sits away from windows to avoid pollen exposure

accommodations_modifications.name: Seizure action plan and emergency protocol
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Ensures safety and appropriate response during episodes
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Episodes of medical emergencies or seizures
accommodations_modifications.example: Staff trained on how to respond to student’s tonic-clonic seizures

accommodations_modifications.name: Use of visual timers and step-by-step routines
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Improves task completion and reduces impulsivity
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Behavior that appears impulsive or inattentive
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a visual timer for each center activity

accommodations_modifications.name: Consistent classroom structure and preview of transitions
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Requires a predictable and structured routine
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher provides daily agenda and pre-transition countdown

accommodations_modifications.name: Health monitoring and check-ins with nurse or counselor
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Tracks changes in health and alertness
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Sudden changes in performance or alertness
accommodations_modifications.example: Student checks in with nurse each morning to monitor blood sugar

accommodations_modifications.name: Instruction in self-regulation strategies
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps student develop coping skills and emotional awareness
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Difficulty with self-monitoring and emotional regulation
accommodations_modifications.example: Student uses a calm-down corner and charts feelings using visuals
